description: I was a little disappointed when we drove up because I was expecting to see the park in front and the house is now painted purple but my cousins from Seattle seemed to be excited by it.  ;) My 10 year old cousin is a big fan of Full House so it was a big deal for her to see it and take pictures in front of it.  There's nothing special, just a house so don't waste your time unless you're a huge fan of the show.
author: Isela E.

description: HOW RUDE...! We first visited The Painted Ladies. After a couple of minutes, we quickly realized that this was NOT where the Full House house was located. Ahhh!!! Thanks to Yelp, we located the actual address, called for a Lyft, and headed there excited to see the house we all grew up wishing we lived in. We were fortunate to arrive to a relatively quiet scene, with only a couple of other fans taking pictures. As we double and triple checked the address, we came to the heart breaking realization that although this was in fact the right house, it was the WRONG house - the exterior facade and colors have been changed so significantly that it is almost unrecognizable. Others began arriving at the scene and we all lamented the changes that have been made. Don't get me wrong. The house is or I should say would be beautiful if it were any other house. It's just not THE beautiful Tanner house we expected to see. Nonetheless, if you grew up watching and loving Full House, it is a must see in SF.
author: Tash L.

description: It's purple now :( A must see touristy spot in SF if you loved the show (which I definitely did growing up), but don't expect to see the same house shown in each episode. And beware cause there's a no trespassing sign hanging across the entrance.
author: Kim D.

description: Me and a friend took our kids to see the full -house (House) last week it looks so different now then the tv show series. They have a gate that goes over the steps and the color of the house has changed.
author: Monique C.

description: We had to take a 45-minute detour through San Francisco just so my wife could see the Full House house. It was definitely the house from the show, but there's not really much more to say about it than that. At least it satisfied my wife's need for childhood nostalgia.
author: Jared K.

description: This was fun.  I mean your just checking out a house so it is really quick and then you can check out the painted ladies.
author: Brent S.

description: Nothing spectacular just someone's house now that def doesn't like trespassers!  Cute little street in SF!
author: Lyndsi W.

description:
Yeah, that picture does it just about right! This is the house that's the facade from Full House. You'll be dreadfully confused if you think you're going to see the Painted Ladies, though to be fair, there are a lot of houses that are reminiscent of the Painted Ladies in the Pacific Heights neighborhood!

For the die-hard fans: a must do.
For the rest of us: interesting, but not worth going out of your way for.
author: Valerie S.

description:
(This review is for Alamo Square row houses- the opening shot of the show.) 

Pretty underwhelming, especially since they a) have been painted and don't look the same as the show or the pictures of them on TV and b) they don't look nearly as good as the pictures and post cards you always see. There are too many interesting/beautiful/quirky things to see in San Francisco to waste your time on this forgettable site. If you DO have out of town huests who insist on going, couple it with a lunch somewhere in Hayes Valley or a trip to the food trucks a couple of blocks south.
author: Greg J.

description: Full House has been my favorite show since i was about 8 years old. i have seen every episode and know all the lines from every episode, i dominate anyone at full house trivia =) i came here on a whim. the house was recently painted, i guess there trying to discourage people from coming here, thats never going to happen, the show was too big and great, i went on a monday afternoon about noon and there were 5-10 people taking pictures and posing in front of the house. the door has not been red for some time. i hope they keep the reruns going for a long long time, i still watch this show daily and it never gets old.   jesse and the rippers forever!!!! have mercy!
author: Lee W.

description: It is what it is. Pretty easy to park. Pretty easy to find. Get your picture and respect its cultural significance. I give it a 4 because there isn't much to it.
author: Pete K.

description: Two stars because whoever owns it now decided it would be awesome to ruin history by painting the house blue. Thanks a lot inconsiderate jerks. I bet they'd paint the Golden Gate Bridge blue if they had a chance.
author: John S.

description: It looks like it's been repainted several times... to blend in more. If you're gonna buy the Full House house, you'd think you'd be loud and proud about it... maybe that's just me. It's a house, it's nice, that's all.
author: Mahsa K.

description:
I'm not sure when it was painted, but I just visited the house yesterday and it is a completely different color (blue to be exact). Just doesn't have the same "Full House" feel. 
Oh well, it was still cool to see the house.
author: Josh D.

description: My friend and I were lucky enough to find parking right in front of the house because we went there really early around 7-8am. The dead tree in the front is covering the majority of the house :( I still enjoyed it because that was one of the main things I wanted to see in San Fran.
author: Jen J.

description: Was very touching to see the house, take some pic, i would be nice if we could go inside but there is actual ppl that live there now, thats the only reason i give it a 3 stars!
author: Ny N.

description: Being a huge fan of the show, I had to stop by on my most recent trip to San Fran! It doesn't look the same at all but it was still really cool to see. There's not a park across the street just FYI. It's more houses. But still glad I got to see the house!
author: Nikki D.

description:
These other reviews are way off base and just flat out wrong! I had A BLAST and the house did not disappoint.

The Full House House was my main selling point when convincing the family that we should take a cross-country road-trip. I have a few skeptics in the family (Brandon) but even they agreed that it was worth the long hours in the car. Needless to say, I'm a HUGE House fan, and I've practically modeled my life after the Tanners.  

Seeing the House IRL was unreal!  This was literally a dream come true.  I felt like I had walked right into the TV set! We spent the first day just taking photos with the House and sitting on the steps! Day two involved acting out some beloved scenes from the show in front of the house. I didn't want to go and I literally had to be dragged away from this beloved piece of american TV history!

We even got to cross the big red Full House bridge into  SF that is featured in shows intro! A perfect trip!

Highly recommend if you can afford it. 
4 out of 5 stars!

"When you're lost out there and your all alone
A light is waiting to carry you home
Everywhere you look."

**Note:
The House lost a star from my rating for two reasons. 
Firstly because someone decided it was a good idea to paint the iconic red door black... which is completely insane and a bummer for obvious reasons. Also the people living at the house were very unfriendly and rude. I mean if you are going to live in a famous house you should at least be a nice person. 
And my second reason was because this kind of a trip can be prohibitively expensive if you are coming from the East coast. Between gas prices and the time my Wife and I took off work, we ended up pretty deep in the hole. 
But those are very minor complaints when were talking about something as awesome as seeing the Full House House in real life!
author: Alan R.

description: Stupid don't go. We waited FOREVER for the family that lives there to come outside and they are not like the Full House family in ANY way nor are any of the neighbors recognizable. Some idiot painted the front door so it barely even looks like the 3 second clip from the opening of Full House. Wasn't even worth posting the pictures of the family to facebook, what a bust.
author: Ben O.

description: The Full House house is a landmark lol!  It is sad to see that the color has changed to purple, but it was still awesome to see it in person and reminisce about the good ol' Full House days.
author: Mindy T.

description:
A house is a house is a full house. What?

I like looking at the pictures above and seeing the evolution of trespassing prevention enacted by the occupants. From no barricade to chain to fence with "No Trespassing" sign.
author: Greg W.

description: Checked this off my bucket list! I am a huge Full House fan, so this was definitely worth checking out. The only thing is it doesn't have the red door anymore and you can't sit on the steps. My friend and I took a few pictures and were on our way! Didn't see Kimmy Gibbler across the street though...
author: Jillian C.

description: It's cool to see the actual house that was aired on "full house". Yes,  it has been painted and there is a tree in front.  However,  this house has people living in there. Can't complain, it is a must see at least once if you are around the area.
author: Ly L.

description: really cool to see the house in person, my husband were in the city killing time before dinner and a show and we decided to drive by. It's fun to see this kind of stuff but totally not what we were thinking it would look like or where the location would be. We thought there would be a park close by like the show had. Not sure how they decided on the house but like i said it was neat to see! They for sure painted the home since.
author: Brittany E.

description: Feeling nostalgic, we not only visited Mrs Doubtfires home, but we finished our explorations to The Tanner home from Full House. The color of the house changed, but to have the memories of your childhood in front of your eyes, was priceless!
author: Charley B.

description: Going to San Francisco as a tourist and being able to see your childhood tv show in the famous house the "Tanners" lived in gets you excited; not the case once you arrive. Arrived at the so call famous house and the house in general isn't the problem the REAL PROBLEM, watch out for the blonde little mermaid Ursula's twin sister witch (drop the w and exchange it for a b please) tenant or whoever she is that lives there) I'm sorry but if your going to live in a famous property one should be proud of it. Not the case with the sac of old booted bones that came out and yelled at my family "this is private property: OFF" umm ok sorry "no not sorry "OFF" yep not the type of image or sour taste in your mouth you want I didn't even want to take a picture anymore. Honestly if the owner or tenant reads this review word of advice "YOU LIVE IN A PROPERTY THAT WILL ENCOUNTER TOURIST ALL THE TIME!!!" Be humble and respectful when a tourist wants to take a quick picture as opposed to yelling like a dealing banshee into the night! We're not asking you to see the inside of your house nor are we asking for charity. It's called manners and unfortunately you have none.
author: Leslie E.

description: the house is definatley worth seeing if you always watched the Full House show! it's so cute & it brings back memories from watching the show. although it's not the same color as it was, it's still something pretty neat to check out while your in San Francisco. don't leave without seeing it!!
author: Sarah H.
